observation: I can see the country/region dropdown is open and showing a long list of countries. The page shows various countries from Afghanistan to Zimbabwe. I can see that Indonesia (element 209 with text '🇮🇩 Indonesia') is visible in the list. From my persona as an elderly user who needs simple interactions, I should select a country that is clearly visible and avoid trying to search. Indonesia appears to be a good option that's already visible.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user, I need to select a country from this dropdown list. I can see Indonesia is visible in the list (element 209). This is a good choice as it's clearly visible and doesn't require scrolling or searching. I should tap directly on Indonesia to select it.
ux_issues: The country list is very long and overwhelming for elderly users
Small text size may be difficult to read
No clear categorization or common countries section

outcome.visual_observation: The UI transitioned from a country selection dropdown list to a residence selection form. The dropdown disappeared and was replaced with a cleaner interface showing 'Select your residence' as the main heading, explanatory text about showing available products/services, a dropdown showing 'Indonesia' as selected, a red 'Next' button, and a 'Log in' link at the bottom.
